DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate repeatability reproducibility corneal ( include corneal , epithelial , stromal , LASIK flap thickness ) anterior segment measurement use ArcScan Insight 100 high-frequency digital ultrasound arc-scanner .
DOC.brief_title: Repeatability Reproducibility ArcScan Insight 100 VHF Digital Ultrasound
DOC.detailed_description: Very high-frequency ( VHF ) digital ultrasound first used 1993 obtain image cornea ( window front eye ) anterior segment ( space behind cornea include iris lens ) . A commercially available instrument , call Artemis 2 , use routine clinical practice since 2001 . The Artemis 2 CE approve well FDA approval ( US equivalent CE mark ) . The ArcScan Insight 100 VHF digital ultrasound scanner new instrument yet CE mark . However , ArcScan Insight 100 upgraded version Artemis 2 , difference improvement component , measurement method remain essentially . The aim study establish repeatability ( i.e . variability measurement take single examiner single visit ) reproducibility ( i.e . variability measurement take condition two examiner ) ArcScan Insight 100 device measure corneal anterior segment parameter .
DOC.criteria: INCLUSION CRITERIA Only patient medically suitable corneal refractive surgery include study . As general inclusion criterion follow aspect define : Subjects 21 year age old . Contact lens wearer must stop wear contact lens least four week per decade wear baseline measurement case hard contact lenses one week baseline measurement case soft contact lens . Patient able understand patient information willing sign inform consent . For repeatability reproducibility phase use normal eye study : Eyes ocular pathology Eyes previous ocular corneal surgery For repeatability reproducibility phase use postLASIK eye study : • Eyes 3 9 month LASIK SMILE For comparison ArcScan Insight 100 VHF digital ultrasound RTVue OCT • Either eye corneal refractive surgery EXCLUSION CRITERIA Previous ocular corneal surgery ( normal eye ) Patient able tolerate local topical anesthesia Patient active conjunctivitis active ocular infection inflammation Patient corneal ulcer Patient open wound corneal epithelium Patient compromise epithelium ( e.g . ≥Grade 3 superficial punctate keratitis ) Pregnancy
